conclusion: To determine the direction of motion of the particle from 2 to 3 seconds, we need to analyze the velocity-time (v-t) graph provided.
The vertical axis represents velocity (v) in meters per second (m/s).
The horizontal axis represents time (t) in seconds (s).
Positive velocity values indicate motion in the positive direction, while negative velocity values indicate motion in the opposite direction.
At t = 2 seconds, the velocity of the particle is 0 m/s.
From t = 2 seconds to t = 3 seconds, the velocity becomes negative, reaching -2 m/s at t = 3 seconds.

premise: The velocity is negative between 2 and 3 seconds.
conclusion: The particle is moving in the opposite direction to the defined positive direction.
